TopicTitle: HOCgaming's THAT'S NO MOON! Base - Craft Submission Thread

Articles.Content:
Name of Utility: LiteWait MunStosity Mk2

Screenshot:

Total Mass of Utility: 5.24 ton wet (no crew)

Part Count: 37

Features: Remote operation; Seats 4; Light in Weight; 2 Docking Ports (1 Jr [bottom], 1 normal [top]); Landing Lights; Long Battery for Dark Ops; Compact

Summery: The LiteWait MunStosity Mk2 (LWMS) is the latest in minimalistic landers from 25inc Astrophysics and Lawn Dart Technologies (ALDT), a subsidiary of 25inc. The LWMS Mk1 was originally designed as an escape pod for space stations and family picnics. The original was single use as it had no way of refueling to a fuel station, whether orbiting or stationary; thus the addition of the normal and junior size docking ports were added for convenience. This modification resulted in Mk2 model while sacrificing the pesky safety parachute.The Mk2 also sports and addition pair of rocket and RCS thrusters to add extra performance on descent and ascent, not to mention racing your friends who are most likely flying lesser imitations. This model also sports the KerbKady remote valet package that allows you to call for your landers wherever you are.

Utility's .CRAFT file: http://www./?csb7b6oa75a5bjm

Your Name: SilkyZ of 25inc

Edited June 21, 2013 by SilkyZ
*ignore the accidental double post*

I present to you, the Puddle Jumper, carries 5 Kerbals, has a probe in case you need to control it without a kerbal on-board. Has a mun base refueling port that I have tweaked to mate with your mun base rover. 4300 m/s of Delta-V according to Mechjeb, so about 3 trips to mun orbit and back before refueling. Also has a Sr. Docking Port on the bottom, just in case.

Action Group 1 lowers ladders.

Though not as efficient as Nukes, the aerospikes deliver efficient power, because long burns aren't fun.

Note: Mechjeb is not on it, I just used the module to check dv and then removed it.

Name: Puddle Jumper

Mass: 35.54 tons (fully fueled)

Part Count: 44

Name to credit: DerpN3rd (my alter ego )

Link to dl:

http://www./download/ll88ar49uxy4p7s/Puddle_Jumper.craft

Pics:

Hallo Harv and all you HOC-Gaming Fans!

I have edited the Bi-Tech Mun Shuttle a bit, and I present:

Bi-Tech Mun Shuttle MK III (ooh dat imagination)

The shuttle is equipped with 2 nuclear engines and the most powerfull of the small engines.

The shuttle have room for 3 Kerbals with an addition of 2 Bi-Tech Mun Scoots! Yeah these are RCS powered Mun scooters are capable of flying much further than the propulsion-pack of a kerbal!

A few pics of it:

The ship flying:

http://i1314.photobucket.com/albums/t561/breaumsidears/Bi-Tech%20Mun%20Shuttle%20MK%20II/screenshot202_zps718bfc0f.png

Jeb ofc got the skills to land the craft on the Mun by the soul use of his in-cockpit instruments!

http://i1314.photobucket.com/albums/t561/breaumsidears/Bi-Tech%20Mun%20Shuttle%20MK%20II/screenshot213_zpsea7555f3.png

The scooter on a post!

http://i1314.photobucket.com/albums/t561/breaumsidears/Bi-Tech%20Mun%20Shuttle%20MK%20II/screenshot176_zps382701bd.png

Jebediah on a Mun Scooter:

http://s1314.photobucket.com/user/breaumsidears/media/Bi-Tech%20Mun%20Shuttle%20MK%20II/screenshot241_zpsff492901.png.html?sort=3&o=257

Shuttle data:

Part counter: 61

Fuel counter: 1260

Metric Tonnes: 25.145

Docking-ports: 2x Standard; 4x Junior

Advanced Staging:

Custum 1: Toggle Main Engine

Custum 2: Toggle Nuclear Engines

Custum 3: Toggle Ladder

Custom 4: Toggle Scooter RCS

Custom 5: Toggle Scooter Accelerometer

The shuttle can be downloaded here:

http://www./download/nzmwvmmk85oborx/BI-Tech_Mun_Shuttle_MK_III.craft

Here is a full photo-shoot of the shuttle:

Who is this crazy Danish person?

Hallo! My name is Breaum, Breaumsidears everywhere else (Broooom's Ideas)

I love watching Harvs videos, and i got this game because of them. Thanks Harv

Have fun with this shuttle, and not least the Mun Scooters guys!

I give you the Ministry of Space Dropship/Shuttle! Two NERVA's for efficiency, and can land on any MUN!

The Dropship!

Download: http://www./view/yun7hh6uwq3yk4y/'MoS'_Shuttle_Dropship.craft

The Kerbal/fuel transporter MkII

http://imgur.com/a/LoGpZ

The Kerbal/fuel transporter MkII, or Transporter for short, is a craft existing out of just 22 parts, with a weight of 33,68 mass units.

It comes with 3 docking ports, 2 on the sides and one on top.

I have set the docking ports up in such a way that rovers should be able to connect without too much sweat, on kerbin it works like a charm with my own rover, based on the ones in you mun base.

The Transporter has 4 engines giving it a max power of 4 times 120.00, even though is may be a little bit of an overkill, it keeps the transporter quite stable and is able to accelerate really fast if needed.

There is enough room to support 5 kerbals, 1 in the control pod and 4 in the container.

The only action group set is set to the '1' key, toggling both the legs and the ladder.

Of course everybody is free to download, hope you have some fun with the craft

The Download link:

https://docs.google.com/file/d/0B1oGFmc1oAnsTWNQX25LUElmX3c/edit?usp=sharing

Rubie3000:cool: out

What better way to land on Mun than with 6 cheering kerbals strapped on the craft!

Please let me introduce you the Tricorne IIb, developed by norso

Mass: 38.92 t

Parts: 71

Crew Capacity: 7 (6 seats + Cupola)

Delta-V: 3685 m/s (enough for several mun landings/takeoffs)

Docking Ports: 2 standard, 2 small

Tricorne IIb has undergone several tests, and proved to be very durable.

All struts and fuel lines are hidden inside wings/tanks in sake of clean design

It can survive landing at up to 12m/s with no damage! (tested on both Kerbin and Mun)

Thanks to 3 independent sets of landing legs you can slightly adjust the position of the docking port for easy docking.

With it's 6 seats it's is ideal for sudden crew evacuation, as well as adrenaline sightseeing trips.

The B variant is carrying a docking port on side, which enables it to dock with the KepeTech Refueling Station and other crafts as well as grabbing them with it's bottom port.

It has Advanced S.A.S (hidden inside the craft) as well as RCS, which comes handy at docking.

Action groups:

1 - Toggle engines

2 - Toggle landing legs

3 - Toggle landing lights

4 - Toggle craft illumination

5 - Toggle ladder

More pics: Front - Side - Landed on Mun - On LaunchPad with full crew

Craft file: http://www.fileswap.com/dl/olbQ9c6OvM/ old version

Edit: Here is an improved version of Tricorne IIb - now only 64 parts! (only fuel lines and few struts were changed, also a misplaced generator was relocated)

Adjusted version: http://www.fileswap.com/dl/eS8Fpdi1B/

P.S. Also a few more statistics:

Fuel capacity is 2170 liquid fuel

With full fuel it can land from 15km with using just ~600 fuel and needs only ~280 fuel to get into 15km orbit (when taking off with total of 360 fuel), which means it can deliver over 1200 fuel at a time

Edited June 26, 2013 by norso
adjusted version added

Coming in at 3 mass units and 17 parts, the Light Kerbal - Lifter MkI is a tiny little rocket with an engine fit for a craft 10 times as big. It can achieve a Delta-V of 1,950 m/s fully loaded with four kerbals, and can have a maximum of 11.56 G of acceleration on the MUN. This thing is FAST. Features include: autonomous mode for return trips, thanks to the latest in probe core technology, a docking port for safe parking in orbit, and an ASAS unit for precise orbital maneuvers. It has a fuel efficiency of 390 ISP in vacuum.

Craft File: https://docs.google.com/file/d/0B4ikxBzoO6g0OURaRVZvbVhSNFk/edit

Coming in at 17.8 mass units and 25 parts, this ship is relatively heavy. Armed with 2 LV-909 engines it has a TWR of 3.44 on the Mun and has a total Delta-V of 969 m/s. It has a probe core fitted for non-kerbal assisted flights and has solar and passive power production. Also comes standard with landing lights and a top mounted docking port for orbital station parking.

Craft File: https://docs.google.com/file/d/0B4ikxBzoO6g0M3BtZ01ZZ3ExZWc/edit?usp=sharing

http://imgur.com/Hs0bxJR

Name - FactoryX Shuttle

Screenshots - http://s222.photobucket.com/user/Mazlem/library/KSP/FactoryX-Shuttle

Made by Mazlem

On my first test it had enough fuel to finish its Kerbin orbit, go to the Mun and circularize its orbit there, then land. So I think it's got enough deltaV for the job.

//edit the RCS tanks were not stock so I swapped those out and re-uploaded the save file.
